title: Continuation of the National Emergency With Respect to the Situation in and in Relation to Syria
summary: The document is a notice from the President of the United States, published in the Federal Register on October 2, 2025, regarding the continuation of the national emergency with respect to the situation in and in relation to Syria. The notice explains that the national emergency, initially declared in 2019, is being extended for another year due to ongoing threats to national security and foreign policy. The situation in Syria is described as undermining the campaign against ISIS, endangering civilians, and threatening regional peace, security, and stability. The notice also highlights the need for accountability for war crimes, human rights violations, and narcotics trafficking networks associated with the former regime of Bashar al-Assad. The extension of the national emergency is in accordance with the National Emergencies Act.
